Project Team

Dylan Childs ,

Find out more

Rob Edwards Head of School of Agriculture, Food and Rural Development, University of Newcastle

My interests are focused on the biotransformation of herbicides and other biologically active chemicals in crops and weeds and how this can be used for biotechnological applications and in defining selective toxicity and resistance in plants. Find out more

Rob Freckleton ,

Find out more

Jarrod Hadfield ,

Find out more

Paul Neve Senior Research Scientist, Weed Ecology & Evolution, Rothamsted Research

With a particular interest in herbicide resistance, my research is focussed on understanding the ecological and evolutionary processes that result in the establishment, persistence and spread of weed populations in agroecosystems. Working with weed populations, simulation models and model organisms, I investigate strategies for ‘evolution-free’ management of agricultural weeds. Find out more

Ken Norris Director of the Centre for Agri-Environmental Research, University of Reading

My research focuses on the inter-relationships between land-use, biodiversity and ecosystem services. I am particularly interested in assessing the environmental risks of agricultural systems, and understanding how these risks might be managed. Find out more
